page.title: 13HOUSING:WOODTON AREA
page.content: There are 94 dwellings in this block, of which 62 lie within Woodton's village guideline.Building outside the planning guideline is allowed only in exceptional circumstances.The guide- lines are being updated by Norfolk C.C but may not be greatly extended.The majority of these dwellings are owner- occupied:of the 63 houses,15 are rented,12 being council houses,& of the 31 bungalows 15 are rented,14 being 'homes for the elderly'.Three council properties have been sold to their occupants since 1980. The older dwellings are houses or cottages,some of the latter have been modernised into single-,from double-dwellers. Many of the post-1918 dwellings are bungalows-Norfolk's favourite-or chalet-bungalows.About half have been built since 1945,in effect 'infilling' to create nucleated villages.
